title: Create 'Be My Valentine' interactive romantic multi-section page with animations, music, and playful buttons

requirements.text: Implement a single-page React (TypeScript) experience that reproduces the provided HTML concept as 5 sequential sections ("pages") with a Next button to navigate forward (Page 1 â†’ Page 5) and a smooth fade-in transition when the active page changes.
acceptanceCriteria: App renders 5 distinct sections with the same headings/structure as the provided HTML, adapted to React components.
Only one page is visible at a time; the active page fades in on change.
A Next button is present on pages 1â€“4 and navigates to the next page.

requirements.text: Convert all user-facing text to English and ensure no non-English paragraph text is shown in the UI; preserve the romantic tone and overall meaning of Page 5 content while rewriting it fully in English.

quotes: Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.

acceptanceCriteria: All visible paragraphs/headings/buttons are in English (emojis may remain).
The long Page 5 paragraph is replaced with an English-only romantic message of similar intent (no Tamil/non-English words shown).

requirements.text: Recreate the ambient animations from the provided HTML using React-safe DOM management (create/remove elements cleanly to avoid memory leaks): falling hearts, glitter sparkles, floating roses, floating kiss bubbles, and a bouncing teddy in the bottom-right corner.
acceptanceCriteria: Falling hearts continuously appear at random x positions and fall off-screen; each heart is removed after a short lifetime.
Glitter sparkles appear at random positions and fade/scale out; sparkles are removed after their animation.
Roses rise from the bottom and rotate; each rose is removed after a short lifetime.
Kiss bubbles float upward and fade; each bubble is removed after a short lifetime.
A teddy element is visible bottom-right and bounces continuously.

requirements.text: Implement the playful 'No' button behavior on Page 5: clicking 'No' moves the button to a random position within the viewport so it is difficult to click repeatedly.

quotes: function moveNo() { const no = document.getElementById('noBtn'); no.style.left = Math.random() * 80 + '%'; no.style.top = Math.random() * 80 + '%'; }

acceptanceCriteria: On Page 5, clicking 'No' relocates the button to a new random on-screen position (kept within the visible viewport).
The 'No' button remains clickable and does not move off-screen.

requirements.text: Replace the Page 5 'Yes' button JavaScript alert with an in-app UI confirmation state (e.g., modal/dialog or inline success message) that celebrates the 'Yes' response.

quotes: <button id="yesBtn" onclick="alert('Yay! You said YES! â¤ï¸')">Yes ðŸ’•</button>

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking 'Yes' shows a visible success/celebration message in the UI without using window.alert.
The confirmation UI can be dismissed or remains visible without breaking navigation/animations.

requirements.text: Add a loading screen overlay that displays a heart and an English 'Loadingâ€¦' message on initial load, then automatically disappears after ~2 seconds.
acceptanceCriteria: A full-screen loading overlay is shown when the app first renders.
The overlay automatically hides after approximately 2 seconds.
After hiding, the user can interact with the app normally.

requirements.text: Support background music playback via a bundled local audio asset and provide basic user controls (play/pause and mute/unmute). If autoplay is blocked by the browser, the UI must prompt the user to start playback.
acceptanceCriteria: Music plays in a loop once started (autoplay if allowed; otherwise after user gesture).
A visible control is present to play/pause and mute/unmute.
The audio source is a local file bundled with the frontend static assets.

requirements.text: Support the four images referenced in the provided HTML (photo1.jpg, photo2.jpg, photo3.jpg, yourphoto.jpg) as static assets and render them on their respective pages with rounded corners.
acceptanceCriteria: Pages 2â€“5 each display the correct image with rounded corners and spacing similar to the provided HTML.
Images are served as frontend static assets (no backend image routing).
If an image file is missing, the UI shows a graceful placeholder state without crashing.

requirements.text: Make the page mobile-friendly: ensure content fits smaller screens, maintain comfortable padding, and keep animations from blocking scrolling/taps (animations must not intercept pointer events).
acceptanceCriteria: On mobile widths, text and buttons remain readable and centered without horizontal overflow.
Ambient animation layers do not block button taps/clicks.
Layout uses responsive styling (Tailwind) rather than relying on direct document.body style mutation.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent Valentine-themed visual design using Tailwind (avoid a blue/purple primary palette): soft romantic background, consistent typography scale, card-like page container, and button styles consistent across all pages.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI has a consistent Valentine aesthetic (e.g., warm pinks/reds, soft neutrals) across all pages.
Buttons, headings, and paragraph styling are consistent across pages.
Design avoids a blue/purple primary palette.

constraints: Frontend must be built with React + TypeScript and styled with Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui composition (do not edit read-only component sources under frontend/src/components/ui).
Do not modify files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose them instead.
Backend must remain single-actor Motoko; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Persisting user responses or analytics to the backend.
Adding external music/image hosting or third-party APIs.
